page.title: 04ALL SAINTS CHURCH STAND.
page.content: Stand All Saints Church has a most interesting history. The building started in 1822 using part of the million pounds set aside for the errection of churches by the government to give thanks for victory over Napoleon. The churches length is 50m and breadth 25.5m whilst the height of its square tower is 50m. The tower forms a landmark for many miles around. From the tower, you can see many roads coming towards Whitefield from great distances. The church stands on one of the highest spots in this part of the county, on a hill over 114m above sea level. Looking south west the {River Mersey}and{Cheshire Plain}can be seen, to the north east the{Pennines} and{Blackstone Edge.}
